Original_Text: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar weakened against the euro on Monday as investors awaited key U.S. economic data, signaling caution amid concerns over rising inflation pressures.
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Apple Inc. unveiled a new software update for its iPhone, enhancing security features to address growing concerns over data privacy.
LONDON (AFP) - British Airways announced a restructuring plan to cut costs, including reducing staff at its Heathrow operations, to counter rising fuel expenses.
TOKYO (Reuters) - Sony Corp. reported a 15 percent increase in quarterly profits, driven by strong sales of its PlayStation gaming console.
HONG KONG (Dow Jones) - China's Lenovo Group expanded its market share in the global PC market, acquiring a smaller rival for $500 million.
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. regulators approved a merger between two major pharmaceutical companies, expected to create a leader in generic drug production.
SYDNEY (Dow Jones) - BHP Billiton shares fell 3 percent after the mining giant reported lower-than-expected quarterly earnings due to declining commodity prices.
SAN JOSE (CBS.MW) - Intel Corp. announced a delay in its next-generation chip launch, citing production challenges in its manufacturing facilities.
PARIS (AFP) - The European Union imposed new tariffs on Chinese solar panel imports, escalating trade tensions with Beijing.
CHICAGO (Reuters) - Boeing Co. secured a $2 billion contract to supply commercial jets to a Middle Eastern airline, boosting its order backlog.
